Soyeon

Group (2013):
QBS

Introduction

Soyeon is a South Korean singer and actress under Think Entertainment. She is a former member of T-ARA and its sub-unit QBS.

Soyeon made her debut as a member of T-ara in July 2009 with the single "Lie".

On September 25, 2013, it was announced that Soyeon had been dating Click-B member Oh Jonghyuk.

On July 5, 2016, it was reported the couple had broken up after six years of dating due to their drifting apart because of their busy schedules.

On March 6, 2017, MBK Entertainment announced that T-ARA will be releasing their final album in May, with Soyeon and Boram terminating their contracts after its release. On May 7, MBK Entertainment revealed the group's plans had changed, and that the final album had been rescheduled to release in June 2017, with members Boram and Soyeon not being able to partake due to the expiry of their contracts.

She made her solo debut on February 5, 2021, with the digital single "They Are All The Same".

She then proceeded to release her second digital single called "Interview", on March 24, 2021.

On January 18, 2022, Think Entertainment announced that Soyeon would be marrying soccer player Cho Yumin in November after three years of dating.

However, on November 3, 2022, it was announced that they postponed their wedding ceremony to next year after Cho Yumin was listed on the national team for the 2022 FIFA World Cup warm-up match, although they already completed their marriage registration.
